PHRASE.LANG: A basin shape hat that is made of bamboo and big enough to hide the face. The name comes from “Sando Hikyaku”, a kind of delivery man who wore this hat and traveled between Edo, Osaka and Kyoto three times a month. “Sando” means “three times” in Japanese and “Gasa (Kasa)” refers to hat.[#Legal]

Un chapeau large en forme de bol, conçu avec des bandes de bambou et assez profond pour cacher le visage de son porteur. Son nom signifie "trois fois chapeau", faisant référence aux messagers qui le portaient durant la période Edo, à qui on demandait de faire chaque mois trois fois le voyage vers Edo, Osaka et Kyoto.[#Legal]
竹の皮を編んでつくった、顔が隠れるほど深い「鉢型」の笠。かつて、江戸、大阪、京都を毎月三度ずつ往復していた三度飛脚が身につけていたことが、名前の由来になっている。[#Legal]
대나무를 짜 만든, 얼굴이 숨을 만큼 깊은 삿갓. 일찌기, 에도, 오사카, 쿄토를 한달에 세 번씩 왕래하던 파발꾼이 사용하던 것에서 이름이 유래.[#Legal]

A basin shape hat that is made of bamboo and big enough to hide the face. The name comes from “Sando Hikyaku”, a kind of delivery man who wore this hat and traveled between Edo, Osaka and Kyoto three times a month. “Sando” means “three times” in Japanese and “Gasa (Kasa)” refers to hat.[#Legal]
水盤形狀的竹帽，可以遮掩整個面部。名字取自在古代每個月往返江戶、大阪、京都三次的「三度飛腳」。[#Legal]
水盤形狀的竹帽，可以遮掩整個面部。名字取自在古代每個月往返江戶、大阪、京都三次的「三度飛腳」。[#Legal]

A basin shape hat that is made of bamboo and big enough to hide the face. The name comes from “Sando Hikyaku”, a kind of delivery man who wore this hat and traveled between Edo, Osaka and Kyoto three times a month. “Sando” means “three times” in Japanese and “Gasa (Kasa)” refers to hat.[#Legal]
